description.narrative: By 2022, schools and pre-schools have capacity to apply and monitor quality teaching and learning and are able to address violence, drop-out and absenteeism., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, Moldova national systems and services are more inclusive, able to protect the rights of children, and respond to the needs of the most vulnerable in an equitable way

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, schools and pre-schools have capacity to apply and monitor quality teaching and learning and are able to address violence, drop-out and absenteeism.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF support focused on the Education Sector Analysis generating evidence for the development of the new education sector strategy and policies as well on the inclusion of children with disabilities and Roma children in education, through advocacy events organized together with central and local levels authorities and capacity building of professionals. Quality of education, school attendance, healthy nutrition and implementation of Child Friendly School Standards were the focus of activities in preschools and schools. A funding scheme for preschool was developed to promote efficient use of funds and ensure universal access to quality early education for all children | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades
Existence of curricula and support from educators, teachers and pre-school and school administrators that are inclusive of all children, including children with disabilities and Roma children
Extent to which Education Management Information System (EMIS) provides quality and timely data
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
Education Sector Policy/Plan that includes holistic institutional capacity building to improve awareness, attitude and empowerment to address absenteeism, drop out and violence in and around schools
Availability of quality CFS/CFE standards that are consistent with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models
Existence of early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards
System Strengthening - Early learning - Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4), see guidance
